title: Sigma V9.924 Sigma Hardware and Software Requirements Sept 2024
text: Sigma Hardware and Software Requirements The following hardware and software recommendations are made by K3 based on the experience of our customers and the operating system author’s recommendations. These requirements are effective as of September 2024 and are subject to change without notice. Minimum Hardware and Software Requirements Server Hardware Minimum Recommended Processor Speed Dual core Quad core Memory 4GB 8GB or greater Hard Disk (Free Space) SATA 7200rpm SSD / M.2 RAID-5 (SAS) Important Notes Tape Backup and UPS (battery backup) highly recommended. Hardware must comply with operating system author’s hardware compatibility list. Hardware specifications are based on a dedicated server and 20 concurrent users, if the server has additional workloads placed upon it, they should be factored into these recommendations. Server Software Supported Server Operating Systems Windows 2022 server Windows 2019 server Windows 2016 server Important Notes We do not recommend Windows Small Business Server, for sites larger than 20 concurrent Sigma users. However please discuss with support if this is a requirement. Client Hardware Minimum Recommended Processor Speed 1GHz 2 GHz+ RAM 512MB 1GB+ Hard Disk (Free Space) 5GB 10GB Network Adaptor 100 Base-T 1000 Base-T Display Settings SVGA (1024x768) SVGA (1024 x 768 or greater) Other Hardware Requirements Hardware must comply with operating system author’s hardware compatibility list. Isolated power circuits with surge protection or UPS recommended. Client Software Supported Client Operating Systems Windows 10 Professional or Enterprise Windows 11 Professional or Enterprise Note: To use 64bit Windows clients you will require the appropriate option. Contact your account manager for details.

title: Sigma Financials Data Files
text: Sigma Financials Data Files Sigma Sales creates the following data files for each sales ledger: SASCBAT.nnn Control file for transaction batches imported from the K3-Omnis system. SBALS.nnn Account balances file. This file holds the total debt, turnover, and other balances for each customer account. SDETS.nnn Transaction details file. This file holds the detail lines entered on each transaction. SECVAT.nnn EC VAT file. This file holds details of the items that are to appear on the EC Sales List report. SINPUT.nnn Parameter file for account record import. SLOCK.nnn Record locking file used during account record import. SMAST.nnn Account master file. This file holds details of all your customers. SMASTNDX.nnn Account index file. This is the index file for SMAST.nnn. SMICROSS.nnn Parameter file relating to the K3-Omnis system and used during account record import. SOPEN.nnn Open batch file. This file holds details of each transaction batch entered in the current period and not yet accepted. SPARM.nnn Parameter file. This file holds a series of parameter tables that hold details of exactly how you want the ledger to be processed. It includes such items as report printing sequences, transaction definitions, analysis description and so on, which you specify as described in Section 16.3 Setup. SPARMVAT.nnn VAT parameters file. This file holds details of all of the VAT codes, descriptions and rates that you have defined. SREPS.nnn User-defined report parameters file. This file contains the report parameters that are specific to the sales ledger in use. SSORTNDX.nnn Print sort file. This file holds the alternative sequences for reports. SSTATNDX.nnn EC trade statistics index file. This is the index file for SSTATS.nnn. SSTATPRM.nnn EC trade statistics parameter file. This file holds the EC trade statistics defaults. SSTATS.nnn EC trade statistics data file. This file contains details of all trade statistics data entered into the ledger. All trade statistics are held on this file until they are cleared. STANLNDX.nnn Transaction analysis index file. This is the index file for STRANANL.nnn. STEXT.nnn Account text file. This file holds the name, address, analysis codes for each customer account. STRAN.nnn Transaction file. This file contains details of all transactions entered into the ledger. All transactions are held on this file until they are cleared and have been processed by the period end routines. STRANANL.nnn Transaction analysis file. This file contains transaction analysis text entered as part of the transaction details, such as VAT number and country code. SVAT.nnn VAT details file. This file holds the VAT details entered for each transaction. SXLOG.nnn Exchange transaction file (dual currency ledgers only). This file holds details of all transactions that have been affected by exchange variances during the period. SREPrruu.nnn User-defined report output file (rr is the report number). SREPrruu.HTM HTML report output file (rr is the report number). SREPS.OMS User-defined report parameters file. SSORTBuu.nnn Temporary sort file used during production of user-defined reports. SSUMMuu.nnn Temporary file used during production of sales analysis reports. SSTATTMP.nnn Temporary file used during clearance of EC trade statistics. SSYS.nnn System locking/block file for each ledger. title: Error running Sigma on Windows 10 32 bit O/S
text: Error running Sigma on Windows 10 32 bit O/S 16bit MS-DOS Subsystem error running any actions in Sigma client on Windows 10 32bit operating system. NTVDM has encountered a System Error A device attached to the system is not functioning. Choose 'Close' to terminate the application. Resolution: Open the Control Panel>Turn Windows Features on or off>Legacy Components>Enable NTVDM Open the Command prompt, right click over the Window title bar and select Properties, Tick the option "Use legacy console (requires relaunch)"

title: General Ledger Trial Balance Imbalance
text: To correct a small imbalance in the Sigma General ledger it is possible to enter a One Sided Journal Before you start the Debug option must be switched on by changed the Omnis shortcut to the following:- Once logged in you should see the Debug option on the menu:- General ledger>Input>Enter Transaction>Journals:- Input the Document control total of the imbalance Value:- Enter the header details and click the Add button:- Enter the line details and click OK to add the line and Exit:- Click Debug>Default Screens:- At the pop up Enter the required option enter the number 5:- At the pop up Enter item to be amended enter - (minus):- At the popup Document imbalance - are you sure? select Yes:- The Ledger Posting Summary report will total the value:-

title: General Ledger Year-End Processing
text: General Ledger Year-End Processing The following section explains how you can complete your accounting for the end of the financial year and move on to the next. You need to undertake the following activities: - Complete transaction processing and report production for the final period of the year. This normally finalises the current year actuals for the year, and gives you your year-end Profit and Loss statements, Balance sheet, and any other financial statements you require. However, you can make retrospective adjustments after moving into the new accounting year, if necessary. If appropriate, clear down the balance in your current account(s) to zero, by posting your dividend or retained earnings accounts. If you have set up the current accounts as closed accounts, you will need to open the accounts to do this and then close them again afterwards (see Account Codes). Review the control parameters that specify your original budget, first revision budget, second revision budget and next year budget year end processing rules (see Ledger Control Parameters). Review the control parameters that specify whether the original budget, first revision budget or second revision budget values are to be retained at year end as last year's budgets (see Ledger Control Parameters). Follow the procedure described in Start New Period to set up the calendar for the new financial year and complete the Start New Period for period 1 of the new year. The system updates the files as follows: Current year period balances become last year period actuals. Any one of the original, first revision and second revision budget period values may be used as last year budgets for the new year. The budgets are then either cleared or left intact, according to the control parameter rules (see Ledger Control Parameters). The next year budget period values may be used as the original, first revision or second revision budgets for the new year. After copying, they are either cleared or left intact, according to the control parameter rules (see Ledger Control Parameters). The transactions for all accounts are removed from the transaction files, unless you have set the Retain Transactions Default parameter in the ledger's control parameters to Indefinite. You should note that any transactions that were created prior to the setting of the Retain Transactions Default parameter to this value are also removed. The setting of this flag does not affect transactions that are already on file.

title: Sigma Purchase Ledger Data Files
text: Purchase Ledger Data Files All Purchase Ledger files start with the letter P. Sigma Purchase creates the following data files for each purchase ledger: PBALS.nnn Account balances file. This file holds the total debt, turnover, and other balances for each supplier account. PBANK.nnn Bank details file. This file holds bank account details for those suppliers who are paid by bank giro, and the cheque payee name for those suppliers paid by cheque where the name of the payee is longer than the space allowed on the account master file. PCASH.nnn Sigma Cash interface file. This file holds details of transactions that are to be interfaced with the Sigma Cash Cash Book system. PDETS.nnn Transaction details file. This file holds the detail lines entered on each transaction. PINPUT.nnn Parameter file for account record import. PIRDETS.nnn Invoice Register transaction details file. This file holds the detail lines entered on each Invoice Register transaction. PIRDETIX.nnn Invoice Register details file index. This is the index file for PIRDETS.nnn. PIRINDEX.nnn Invoice Register transaction index file. This is the index file for PIRTRAN.nnn. PIROPEN.nnn Invoice Register open batch file. This file holds details of each Invoice Register transaction batch entered but not yet accepted. PIRTRAN.nnn Invoice Register transaction file. This file contains details of all transactions entered into the Invoice Register. All Invoice Register transactions are held on this file until they are transferred to the purchase ledger. PIRTRANL.nnn Invoice Register transaction analysis file. This file contains transaction analysis text entered as part of the Invoice Register transaction details, such as VAT number and country code. PIRTANDX.nnn Invoice Register transaction analysis index file. This is the index file for PIRTRANL.nnn. PIRVAT.nnn Invoice Register VAT details file. This holds the VAT details entered for each Invoice Register transaction. PLOCK.nnn Record locking file used during account record import. PMAST.nnn Account master file. This file holds details of all your suppliers. PMASTNDX.nnn Account index file. This is the index file for PMAST.nnn. PMICROSS.nnn Parameter file relating to the K3-Micross system and used during account record import. PMPTRN.nnn The Sigma Supply interface file. This file holds information on invoices and credit notes entered into Sigma Purchase for interface to the associated Sigma Supply ledger. POPEN.nnn Open batch file. This file holds details of each transaction batch entered in the current period and not yet accepted. PPARM.nnn Parameter file. This file holds a series of parameter tables that hold details of exactly how you want the ledger to be processed. It includes such items as report printing sequences, transaction definitions, analysis description and so on, which you specify as described in Section 16.3. PPARMVAT.nnn VAT parameters file. This file holds details of all of the VAT codes, descriptions and rates that you have defined. PPAYS.nnn Payments detail file. This file holds details of the provisional payments list. PPAYSNDX.nnn Payments index file. This is the index file for PPAYS.nnn. PREPS.nnn User-defined report parameters file. This file contains the report parameters that are specific to the purchase ledger in use. PSORTNDX.nnn Print sort file. This file holds the alternative sequences for reports. PSTATNDX.nnn EC trade statistics index file. This is the index file for PSTATS.nnn. PSTATPRM.nnn EC trade statistics parameter file. This file holds the EC trade statistics defaults. PSTATS.nnn EC trade statistics data file. This file contains details of all trade statistics data entered into the ledger. All trade statistics are held on this file until they are cleared. PTANLNDX.nnn Transaction analysis index file. This is the index file for PTRANANL.nnn. PTEXT.nnn Account text file. This file holds the name, address, analysis codes for each supplier account. PTRAN.nnn Transaction file. This file contains details of all transactions entered into the ledger. All transactions are held on this file until they are cleared and have been processed by the period end routines. PTRANANL.nnn Transaction analysis file. This file contains transaction analysis text entered as part of the transaction details, such as VAT number and country code. PVAT.nnn VAT details file. This file holds the VAT details entered for each transaction. PVOIDCHQ.nnn Void cheque file. This file holds details of the void cheques printed by the system. PXLOG.nnn Exchange transaction file (dual currency ledgers only). This file holds details of all transactions that have been affected by exchange variances during the period. Sigma Bought also creates the following system and user files: CONTuu.OMS Private user control file. PALOCuu.nnn Temporary file created during payment allocations. PCONT.OMS The Sigma Purchase system control file. PDUMPuu.nnn Temporary post-dated transaction file. PDVuuNDX.nnn Temporary transaction batch index file. PEXTrruu.nnn User-defined report output file for input to spreadsheet or database (rr is the report number). PIRDTPbb.nnn Temporary Invoice Register transaction details file. PIRNART.nnn Temporary Invoice Register transaction file used during period end processing. PIRSTED.nnn Temporary Invoice Register transaction details file used during period end processing. PIRTANuu.nnn Temporary Invoice Register transaction analysis file. PIRTAPuu.nnn Temporary Invoice Register transaction analysis file. PIRTAV.nnn Temporary Invoice Register VAT details file used during period end processing. PIRTNPuu.nnn Temporary Invoice Register transaction file. PIRVTPuu.nnn Temporary Invoice Register VAT details file. PLEDGER.OMS Sigma Purchase ledger file. This file contains a list of the purchase ledgers that you have defined. PLNANART.nnn Temporary transaction analysis file used during period end processing. PLNARTRI.nnn Temporary Invoice Register transaction analysis file used during period end processing. PLOK.OMS Report writer locking file. PNOMIXuu.nnn Temporary index file used during production of purchase analysis reports. PNOMSuu.nnn Temporary file used during production of purchase analysis reports. PREPrruu.nnn User-defined report output file (rr is the report number). PREPrruu.HTM HTML report output file (rr is the report number). PREPS.OMS User-defined report parameters file. This file contains the report parameters that may be used by all purchase ledgers. PSORTAuu.nnn Temporary sort file used during production of user-defined reports. PSORTBuu.nnn Temporary sort file used during production of user-defined reports. PSUMMuu.nnn Temporary file used during production of purchase analysis reports. PSTATTMP.nnn Temporary file used during clearance of EC trade statistics. PSYS.nnn System locking/block file for each ledger. PTEXTuu.TMP Temporary file used during reorganisation of account analysis parameters. PUSERbbb.nnn Transaction import file for batch bbb. PUSERSEL.OMS User-defined report selection choices file. The system also creates the following files for open batches of transactions: PDETSbb.nnn Open batch transaction details file. PTANLbb.nnn Open batch transaction analysis file. PTRANbb.nnn Open batch transaction file. PVATbb.nnn Open batch VAT details file. PIRDETbb.nnn Invoice Register open batch transaction details file. PIRTALbb.nnn Invoice Register open batch transaction analysis file. PIRTRNbb.nnn Invoice Register open batch transaction file. PIRVATbb.nnn Invoice Register open batch VAT details file.

title: Sigma Purchase Ledger Issued Files.
text: Purchase Ledger Issued Files. All Purchase Ledger files start with the letter P. Listed below are all the files that make up your Sigma Purchase system. They comprise the Sigma Purchase programs; the system control files and the report writer data files. They must all be present while the system is being used. Two of the issued files have the extension .ORG. These files (PREPS.ORG and PUSERSEL.ORG) contain report and selection parameters for the report writer. When you first install your purchase ledger the system copies these files so that their extension is .OMS. Five of the issued files have the extension .ODF. Two of these files are used by the report writer: The PHELP.ODF file contains the helpful messages displayed by the report writer when defining your report parameters. The PTRANLIT.ODF file contains file information used by the report writer when defining and printing your reports. The other three files (PMENU.ODF, PMENUOPT.ODF and PSUBMENU.ODF) contain details of the menu options available in Sigma Purchase. title: Sigma Purchase Ledger - Batch in use.
text: Sigma Purchase Ledger - Batch in use. When entering transactions into the Sigma Purchase Ledger and the transactions are entered as a batch with a batch number. If the Enter Transaction process fails, the batch will be left in use. The user can clear the batch by running Purchase Ledger>Tools>Reset Ledger and this process will delete the “in use” batch.

title: Correcting a duplicate batch import of transactions into Purchase Ledger
text: If a batch has been imported twice in error and an End of Day File Update has not been run, it will be possible to delete the duplicate transactions. If an End of Day File Update has been run it will not be possible to delete the duplicate transactions. To correct this, manual transactions will need to be entered to reverse duplicate transactions i.e. credits or import the same batch again and choose the opposite type of transaction. I.e. if the duplicate batch is Invoices, import again and select Credit Notes.

title: Omnis is updating the interface file
text: Running Sales Ledger>Maintenance>Import Customer Detail and the following error occurs:- This error is a result of a locking file being left behind from last time the function was run. Open Windows Explorer and navigate to the Sales Ledger directory and locate SLOCK.NNN and delete. The SLOCK.NNN = Sales Ledger number. In this example it is Sales Ledger 001.

title: Correcting a duplicate batch import of transactions into Sales Ledger
text: If a batch has been imported twice in error and an End of Day File Update has not been run, it will be possible to delete the duplicate transactions. If an End of Day File Update has been run it will not be possible to delete the duplicate transactions. To correct this, manual transactions will need to be entered to reverse duplicate transactions i.e. credits or import the same batch again and choose the opposite type of transaction. I.e. if the duplicate batch is Invoices, import again and select Credit Notes.
